Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different types of habitats, including at least one land habitat (e.g., playground, garden, forest, parking lot) and one water habitat (e.g., pond, stream, lake).
The student can illustrate various kinds of living things within each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can compare and depict the diversity of plants and animals found in different habitats by showing a variety of living things in each drawing.
The student can observe patterns in plant and animal diversity across different habitats and represent these patterns in the drawings.
The student can plan their drawing by considering how to effectively show and label the different plants and animals in each habitat.
